intro: Cleistanthus meeboldii, commonly known as the yellow-veined cleistanthus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow veins on its leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often surrounded by bracts. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, typically in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
